title: Ticket #4125: Separate log file for POST script terminated events?
description:
It might make sense to have DAGMan write and read the POST script terminated events to/from a separate log file (separate from either the overall workflow log or the individual log files specified in node job submit files). That would avoid having DAGMan writing to a log file that other Condor processes are also writing to (probably especially helpful if we do #963: Have a Condor event logging daemon that does all log file writing).

Also see #3994: Require DAGMan to run in workflow log mode?, #4059: DAG-level NOOP jobs shouldn't need submit file if using workflow log.

Sadly, I guess if we do this we'd need another knob to allow the user to specify the path for this log file... (Unless we just say it has to be the workflow log with some fixed extra extension added.)
remarks:

Do this only after checking with Miron that it's okay, and only after doing #4550 and #4528.

2015-Feb-06 10:11:07 by wenger:
Oh, yeah -- if we do #4809, the "submit failed" events would obviously go into this log. (The main idea of this is to have DAGMan not write to the "main" workflow log that the schedd knows about.)

Design document:

https://docs.google.com/a/wisc.edu/document/d/1I-nk2ZbxFC9m1T1azEi-XDy73XobV5mTG0jfhjLZ5a4/edit?pli=1

2015-Feb-17 12:34:09 by wenger:

2015-Feb-17 13:02:01 by wenger:

2015-Jun-23 11:11:15 by wenger:

2015-Dec-18 15:40:44 by wenger:
Miron wants a report on why/whether we actually need to log POST script terminated events before we do this. (Also see #4809 and #4727 and report about those.)

2015-Dec-23 11:18:47 by wenger:
Ah, we also need this log file for the "fake" events that DAGMan writes for NOOP nodes. (Hmm -- maybe if we implement #5445 splitting off the log isn't so critical?)

I think that one thing that Miron is concerned about is that if we do this there are two separate log files the user has to worry about...
